title: witnessing
comment: The task of declaring what has happened, especially in relation to the life, death and resurrection of Jesus Christ. Believers are given the responsibility of proclaiming the good news of Jesus Christ to the world at all times and in all places.

children.title: witnessing, importance of
children.comment: Sharing the good news about God and Jesus Christ with others is a work to which some believers have a special calling, but in which all believers are to take part.

children.title: Witnessing is sharing the truth of God

primaryrefs.comment: Paul, in prison for his faith, encourages the young leader, Timothy.

children.title: Witnessing is a task for all God's people
Witnessing is a major aspect of Christian living
Examples of witnessing to Jesus Christ
Witnessing to the resurrection of Jesus Christ
witnessing, approaches to
children.comment: Scripture provides teaching, supported by examples, concerning when believers should witness, the methods they are to use, and the manner of doing it.

seealsos.comment: Paul uses the account of his conversion in witnessing.

children.title: witnessing, and Holy Spirit
children.comment: Christian witnessing is made effective through the empowering, strengthening and guiding of the Holy Spirit. Witnessing is an aspect of spiritual warfare, and believers need supernatural aid to face Satan's opposition.

children.title: The Holy Spirit supports believers in witnessing
The Holy Spirit empowers effective witness
He confirms the testimony of believers
He convinces people of their need
He brings people to new birth
The Holy Spirit guides believers in witnessing

seealsos.comment: Stephen's witnessing leads him to become the first Christian martyr. The English word ``martyr'' comes from the Greek word for ``witness''
